results.title: La Flor de mi secreto = The Flower of my secret
results.creator_credit: Esther Garcia, El Deseo S. A., CiBy 2000 and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description:
Renowned Spanish director Pedro Almodovar returns to the comedy of his earlier works in this humorous yet moving film about a woman in the throes of a creative and emotional crisis. Years of writing bestselling romantic fiction under the pseudonym Amanda Gris have started to take their toll on Leo, who yearns to express herself through a blacker style of writing. Bound by her contract, and immersed in denial over the disintegration of her marriage to Paco, she spirals dangerously toward a total breakdown. Her only salvation appears in the form of Angel, who offers her a job as a critic for a national arts supplement. Leo’s first assignment - to write a critique of her alter ego, Amanda Gris - sets in motion a chain of events which force her to face reality, and sever ties with the fears of the past. A sentimental melodrama, more restrained in tone than the excesses of ‘Kika’ and ‘High Heels’, ‘The Flower of my Secret’ establishes Almodovar as a director sensitive towards female concerns of a romantic and personal nature.

Credits: Producer, Esther Garcia ; director, writer, Pedro Almodovar ; photography, Affonso Beato ; music, Alberto Iglesias ; editing, Jose Salcedo.
Cast: Marisa Paredes, Juan Echanove, Imanol Arias, Carmen Elias, Rossy de Palma, Chus Lampreave.

results.title: La Fille mal gardee
results.creator_credit: Covent Garden Video Productions, BBC-TV and John Vernon
results.brief_description: Set on a farm in a peasant village in the French countryside this delightful ballet tells the tale of the difficult path of young love. Widow Simone (Brian Shaw) is determined to betroth her wilful daughter Lise (Lesley Collier) to Alain (Garry Grant), the eccentric son of a rich farmer, but Lise and her lover Colas (Michael Coleman) conspire to thwart the widow’s plans. Performed by the Royal Ballet under the direction of Norman Morrice at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, choreographed by Frederick Ashton with music by Ferdinand Herold, and featuring the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by John Lanchbery, “La Fille mal gardee” is a whimsical romantic comedy suitable for all ages. The music is beautiful and melodic, and the sets designed by Osbert Lancaster are painted in soft pastel colors and have an almost child-like storybook appeal. Lead dancers Lesley Collier and Michael Coleman compliment each other beautifully but special mention has to be given to Brian Shaw who is just superb in the role of Widow Simone.

results.title: La fille mal gardee
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Virginia Lumsden
results.brief_description: Set in a peasant village in the French countryside this delightful ballet tells the tale of the difficult path of young love. Widow Simone is determined to betroth her wilful daughter Lise to the eccentric son of a rich farmer, but Lise and her lover Colas conspire to thwart the widow’s plans. Features the famous wooden clogs solo by Ray Powell and the ribbon pas de deux by the two main protagonists. This classic, funny and entertaining ballet was choreographed by the great Frederick Ashton and features Ray Powell as the widow Simone. Fiona Tonkin as Lise, David McAllister as Colas and the players are supported by the wonderful Australian Ballet Corps de ballet.

results.title: La Fille Aux Yeux D'email
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Stephane is still trying to operate the subitution of jewels in spite of the constant interruptions of Bicou and his best friend Jacinthe. He hopes to be out of the Opera House just in time to reach ‘L’oiseau de feu’, the cabaret owned by Morales wher he performs his dance number with Gloria. Instead, he finds himself locked up on the roof of the Opera House.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: La Fete Sauvage = the Wilderness Party
results.brief_description:
Animals around the world are shown, primarily in the wild. The movie indicates a strong preference to leave animals in their habitat rather than put them in zoos.

Credits: Director, Frederic Rossif ; writer, Madeleine Chapsal ; photography, Bernard Zitzerman ; music, Vangelis Papathanassiou.
Cast: [Original French narration] Evelyne Dress, Gerard Falconetti, Myriam Mezieres.

results.title: La Femme Infidele = the Unfaithful Wife
results.creator_credit: Andre Genoves, Les Films La Boetie, Cinegai and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
A respectable middle-class husband, complacently happy in his marriage, discovers that is wife has been having an affair with another man. He confronts the lover and kills him in an attempt to save his marriage. This film is the first of a trilogy on adultery (all starring Chabrol’s then wife, Stephane Audran) including ‘La Rupture/The Breakup’ (1970) and ‘Juste avant la Nuit/Just before Nightfall’ (1971). Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Andre Genoves ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writer, Claude Chabrol ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen ; art direction, Guy Littaye ; editor, Jacques Gaillard.
Cast: Michel Bouquet, Stephane Audran, Maurice Ronet, Michel Duchaussoy, Donatella Turi.

results.title: La Femme En Bleu = the Woman in Blue
results.brief_description:
Pierre, a famous musician, shares his time between his work and Aurelie, his lover. He becomes fascinated by a beautiful stranger, all dressed in blue, he saw only once and uses all his resources and connections to try and find her again.

Credits: Producer, Andre Genoves ; director, Michel Deville ; writers, Michel Deville, Francois Boyer, Leo L. Fuchs ; photography, Claude Lecomte ; music, Bela Bartok, Franz Schubert.
Cast: Michel Piccoli, Lea Massari, Michel Aumont, Simone Simon, Genevieve Fontanel.

results.title: La Femme du Boulanger = the Baker's Wife
results.brief_description:
A village baker refuses to bake bread when his attractive young wife runs off with a handsome shepherd, a situation that forces the bread-less villagers to take action. Pagnol, combining the best of his humour with sympathetic characterizations of Provencal life, gives an individual drama of infidelity a collective dimension.

Credits: Producer, Charles Pons ; director, Marcel Pagnol ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Georges Benoit, Roger Ledru ; music, Vincent Scotto ; editor, Suzanne de Troeye.
Cast: Raimu, Ginette Leclerc, Fernand Charpin, Robert Vattier, Edouard Delmont, Maxilienne, Robert Bassac, Marcel Maupi, Paul Dullac, Charles Moulin.

results.title: La Femme de Ma Vie = Woman in My Life
results.brief_description:
Simon is a virtuoso violonist and an alcoholic. One night, he collapses during a live-to-air TV concert. Following the incident, he is submerged with shame and avoids his wife, Laura. Laura is the women to whom Simon owes his career ever since she set up and managed the orcherstra Simon plays in. In the depth of his crisis, Simon meets Bernard who has been through the same experiences. As Bernard undertakes to heal Simon he unwittingly becomes Laura’s rival who cannot accept to see Simon receiving assistance from anybody but her. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) - Best New Director of a Feature Film 1987.

Credits: Producer, Yannick Bernard ; director, Regis Wargnier ; writers, Catherine Cohen, Alain Le Henry, Regis Wargnier, Alain Wermus ; photography, Francois Catonne ; music, Romano Musumura.
Cast: Christophe Malavoy, Jane Birkin, Jean-Louis Trintignant, Beatrice Agenin, Elsa Lunghini, Florent Pagny, Dominique Blanc, Didier Sandre, Andrzej Seweryn.

results.title: La Femme Aux Bottes Rouges = the Woman with Red Boots
results.creator_credit: Raymond Vogel, Jordan Bojillon and Juan Bunuel
results.brief_description:
Francoise Leroy, a young and unknown writer, has supernatural gifts. She becomes acquainted with Perou, an old millionaire who loathes artists. Perou is smitten by the young woman whom he saw naked once. He starts stalking her and discovers she lives with Richard, a painter, but that she is secretely attracted to Marc, her publisher, to whom she sends letters. Perou intercepts these letters and sends replies to Francoise, pretending to be Marc. Then, he proceeds to help Marc, who is married, to kill his wife. Finally, he invites the young woman and her two rival lovers to spend time at his house. There, the final show down takes place between an old man who has already destroyed several artists’ lives and the young woman with strange powers.

Credits: Producers, Jordan Bojillon, Raymond Vogel ; director, Juan Bunuel ; writers, Jean-Claude Carriere, Juan Bunuel, Pierre-Jean Maintigneux, Clem Wood ; photography, Leopold Villasenor.
Cast: Catherine Deneuve, Fernando Rey, Jacques Weber, Adalberto-Maria Merli, Jose Sacristan, Emma Cohen, Laura Betti.
